page.title: 06Life in Easington Colliery 2
page.content: Leon is a member of the Colliery Band. He wrote - Life in the Colliery Band is not so easy because I have got to practice almost every night for at least half an hour. That affects me very much because I can't play out. Sometimes I go out after I have finished practising my cornet. A cornet is like a small trumpet. Our band meets at the band hut in the pit yard to practice on Tuesdays and Fridays. Many of the miners spend their leisure time in the colliery either looking after their pigeons or taking care of their allotments. There are hundreds of allotments around the colliery.
